events.name: Fail fast, learn fast, move fast: A fast introduction to UX and Agile
events.description:
We’ll be hosting a lunchtime workshop session on fast-run user experience design. This session will be both a mix of presentation and interactivity with our UX experts. 

Lunch is on us!
events.location: Our upstairs gallery space, 21 Tanjong Pagar Road, #04-01, Singapore

events.name: Join us for a seminar with PerkinElmer
events.description:
Co-Host: Dr Koh Fong Ming (FB Lab) |   Research Fellow   |  Institute of Cell & Molecular Biology  |  Institute of Cell & Molecular BiologyBiopolis
Hear from Dr Margareta, PerkinElmer APAC Leader for Detection on how our Alpha Technology enables you to assay the most complex samples in one well and with no wash steps.
ABSTRACTAlpha Technologies – Therapeutic research areas
Alpha methodology is widely utilised in cancer, immunological, cardiovascular, metabolic and infectious disease research areas. The methodology has been used in all aspects of research and development, from understanding the biological mechanisms of diseases to research and development of novel small molecule and biotherapeutic drugs. Here we will provide experimental data collected in collaboration with global institutions that will provide insight into the use of this technology in (1) cytokine profiling, biomarker detection assays associated with inflammation, and immune response and repair, (2) screening method for determining inhibitory molecular effects of PD-1 and PD-L1 binding, (3) cell signalling and signal transduction method that directly measures endogenous levels of phosphorylated cellular proteins and secondary messengers in cell and tissue lysates, (4) epigenetic enzymatic assay for readers, writers, and erasers that enable characterisation of multiple target and (5) experimental workflow solutions for 2D and 3D cell culture models.
Alpha technology is a unique homogenous bead-based method developed for applications such as (1) detection and quantification of molecular targets in a variety of sample backgrounds, including biomarkers in serum and plasma, intracellular and membrane-bound proteins in cell lysates, or secreted proteins in cell supernatants; (2) measurement of protein-protein interactions, including large multi-subunit complexes; (3) measurement of various enzyme activities, in particular those leading to post-translational protein modifications such as phosphorylation and epigenetic modifications (4) detection and titration of full sized viral phage particles (5) fundamental and applied immunological research and development, particularly its use in biotherapeutic antibodies detection and characterisation (6) biotechnology applications for antibody screening and process analytics – i.e. purity assessment of biotherapeutics, and (7) immunogenicity assays for quantification of anti-drug antibodies in pre-clinical and clinical studies.
The methods offer high versatility in assay design and can be used to study nearly any biological interaction using small and large molecules, and binding partners of greatly disparate size thus can be applied and customised in many biochemical or cell based experimental designs.
Dr Margareta Sutijia’s BiographyDr. Margareta Sutija has a PhD in biology (molecular biology) & currently holds the position of Business leader for Research reagents, Instruments and Applications for the Asia Pacific region at PerkinElmer.She has seven years of research experience at PhD and postdoctoral level in molecular biology, genomics, bioinformatics, stem cell biology, cell culture, cancer biology, assay development and biochemistry. After which, she spent a number of years as Application Scientist for technology development associated with drug discovery and biotherapeutics research and development. Here she established and developed a number of collaborations with leading academic research institutions which lead to commercialized market products.

events.name: RubySG Meetup (September)
events.description:
Hi fellow Rubyists! Come join us for our September Ruby meetup at TradeGecko! -------------- Meetup Programme 6:30pm: Event Starts. Mingling + food. 7:05pm: Intro 7:15pm: Talk 1 - "RSpec best practice - avoid using before and let" by Bruce Li from Honestbee 7:50pm: Talk 2 - "Safe transactional emails: stories of us against spammers" by Gherry Harahap from TradeGecko 8:20pm: Events / Hiring Announcements.  - Organizing a Ruby event or launching a product? We'd like to hear about it!- Is your company looking to hire Ruby developers? Please share with us!- Anyone can stand up and share something that you find interesting! 8:30pm: Mingling and Networking. See you soon! -------------- Interested to give a talk at future meetups? Whether you have a ready talk or just an idea, let us know! We can help to give you useful advice on how to work on the topic and to prepare so that audience enjoys your presentation! You could share about your startup technology stack, your new RubyGem, your opinions on best practices, or projects you discovered or are working on. And we are especially friendly towards beginners! 5 random Ruby tips - Did you find some interesting Ruby technique or gem? Do you want to show something small but useful? Share your tips with us! --------------  Thanks to TradeGecko for sponsoring the venue!   


Food is sponsored by Silicon Jungles. Thank you!    


Video Recording Many thanks to @engineersftw for video coverage!  --------------  Organisers Mingding  (@hanmd82  | hanmd82@gmail.com)  Grzegorz   (@arnvald     | witek.gregor@gmail.com)  Guo Xiang (@tgx_world | tgx_world@hotmail.com)

events.name: ProductTank #12: UX and UI for Product Managers
events.description: Speaker: Michael Ong + Yitch This month's Product Tank will focus on the topic of UX for Product Managers, featuring talks from Michael Ong and our very own Product Tank organiser Yitch. Michael will give a 25 minute presentation and after that, facilitate an open space about product management, focusing on UX and UI, with your chance to join in and discuss the topics or ask the questions that interest you. Michael's talk and open space session will cover: 1. Real Life experience on how Agile & UX are relevant to software development and How to Integrate Them 2. Challenges in practicing Agile & UX 3. Overcoming challenges in implementing Agile & UX Outline/structure for the Session  30 min • What is User Experience • The Value of User Experience (UX) beyond screens and interfaces- Sharing about Challenges implementing Agile & UX60 min Open Space Discussion to explore topics Takeaways • Understand the value of user experience, beyond just screens and interfaces- Learn to integrate UX data points into your product development decision-making process using personas • Learn how to overcome common business objections to implementing UX processes 60 min  • Open Space Discussion to explore topics  How to Set Product Priorities Great products rarely happen by luck — they involve careful planning, consideration, and management. In this talk, you'll learn how to put together a product or project roadmap that inspires by studying and applying an objective and collaborative prioritization method that balances both value and effort, helping stakeholders focus on what's important and come to consensus. Takeaways • Understand the value of user experience, beyond just screens and interfaces • Learn to integrate UX data points into your product development decision-making process using personas • Learn how to overcome common business objections to implementing UX processes AGENDA 18:30 - Registration starts. 19:00 - Registration ends. 19:00 - Quick intro about ProductTank & a few words from the host. 19:05 - 19:30 - Speaker talk + Q&A 19:30 - 20:30 - Open space session 20:30 - 21:00 - More networking 21:00 - Event ends Notes: • The exact schedule is subject to change, but we’ll definitely start by 7pm • Remember to bring your ID, just in case :) • IMPORTANT: Please be on time. Registration will close at 7pm, and in case you're late, you won't be able to enter until the break About location Ascendas have kindly offered to host this meetup, their address is:Galaxis #10-03, 1 Fusionopolis Pl, Singapore[masked]
events.location: Ascent, 2 Science Park Drive, Lobby, Singapore

events.name: The Power of Data for Digital Marketers
events.description:
Businesses are recording more information than ever about interests, behaviors, and interactions. Beyond that, users are voluntarily sharing information — a treasure trove of data for marketers!

Join General Assembly and special guests for an evening to discuss data driven marketing. Learn alongside other leaders from across organizations and roles, and discover first-hand how to make your team more data-driven and put insights into action.

Panelists: 

- Jessica Beaton, Head of Business, dentsu X
- Jerry Blanton, Head of Marketing & Experience Design, Citi FinTech Asia/EMEA, Citibank
- Kenrick Drijkoningen, Head of Growth, Golden Gate Ventures
- Samit Chowdhury, Regional Marketing Director, Asia Pacific, Tetrapak

Moderator: 

Prerna Pant, General Manager, Circus Social

events.name: September 2017 Meetup
events.description:
If you ever wanted to see the Carousell office from the inside (it's really nice!!), this is your chance! Come and join us for another Python User Group meetup with Pizza & soft drinks sponsored by Carousell. Agenda: 7pm: Meet & GreetWhile everyone arrives, we have the chance to chat and mingle. 

7:30pm: Talk #1: Using Kivy to Write an iOS and Android App by Chao-Jen ChenKivy is an open source Python framework that allows developers to write apps for and run the same code on Linux, Windows, Mac OS X, iOS, and Android. I will walk through an end-to-end process, from coding an app using Kivy library to deploying the same app to iOS and Android devices using Kivy toolchains. Chao-Jen Chen is a university instructor teaching Calculus, Probability, and Linear Algebra. He used to work in the finance industry as fixed income quantitative analyst and FX manager, managing and hedging USD3bn FX exposure to more than 20 currencies. His personal research interest is Singapore’s monetary policy tool, i.e., the SGD NEER (Singapore Dollar Nominal Effective Exchange Rate). In April 2017, he released an app in Google Play and Apple App Store that implemented his SGD NEER model. He also wrote a chapter on numerical computing in finance for a book (F# Deep Dives, published by Manning Publications Co. in December, 2014).  8:00pm: Welcome to async/await by Dima Tisnek Dima will present the paradigm of async/await across a few languages (Python3.6 and ES2017) with some live coding.
events.location: Carousell @ Keppel Towers 2, 240 Tanjong Pagar Road #12-00, Singapore
